intro: Faurea discolor var. cyclolepra, commonly known as the cyclolepra faurea, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often colorful inflorescences. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to the unique environmental conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually grayish-green and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. This variety is considered rare and is of significant ecological and botanical interest in Hawaii.
